edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.metric

Class Metric

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.metric.Metric
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    IntensityPerPixelMetric, ZeroMetric

    public abstract class Metric
extends java.lang.Object
    A quantitative measurement on an image or set of images with an associated mask of regions of interest.
    Author:
    Colin J. Fuller

    • Method Detail

      • quantify

        public abstract Quantification quantify(Image mask,
                      ImageSet images)
        Quantifies the Images. This should always return a RealMatrix with one row per region of interest, where each column in a row corresponds to a scalar quantification of some property of that region of interest for a given input image. Thus, the size of the returned matrix should be (# of regions of interest) x (images.size()).
        Parameters:
        mask - A mask that specifies the region of interest. Subclasses should specify whether this should be binary or have a unique identifier for each region of interest.
        images - An ImageSet of Images to be quantified using the same masks (perhaps corresponding to different color channels, for example).
        Returns:
        A RealMatrix containing all the quantified values; rows correspond to ROIs, columns to input Images.
